publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1364# Dr Sylvia Jackson: Action for Biodiversity—That the Parliament notes with pleasure the recent publication of Action for Scotland’s Biodiversity by the Scottish Biodiversity Group; believes that all departments and agencies of the Scottish Executive should use this as a basis to integrate biodiversity conservation into their plans and programmes; applauds the efforts of Scotland’s local authorities in producing local biodiversity action plans and encourages all departments and agencies of the Scottish Executive to assist authorities in implementing these plans, and urges the Minister for Environment, Sport and Culture to report on these positive steps to the Parliament and, thereafter, report further progress on the implementation in Scotland of the Convention of Biological Diversity every two years.

S1M-1364# Dr Sylvia Jackson: Action for Biodiversity-That the Parliament notes with pleasure the recent publication of Action for Scotland's Biodiversity by the Scottish Biodiversity Group; believes that all departments and agencies of the Scottish Executive should use this as a basis to integrate biodiversity conservation into their plans and programmes; applauds the efforts of Scotland's local authorities in producing local biodiversity action plans and encourages all departments and agencies of the Scottish Executive to assist authorities in implementing these plans, and urges the Minister for Environment, Sport and Culture to report on these positive steps to the Parliament and, thereafter, report further progress on the implementation in Scotland of the Convention of Biological Diversity every two years.
S1M-1364# Action for Biodiversity (lodged on 16 November 2000) Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-1364# Action for Biodiversity (lodged on 16 November 2000) Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1364# Action for Biodiversity (lodged on 16 November 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Elaine Smith*

S1M-1364# Dr Sylvia Jackson: Action for Biodiversity—That the Parliament notes with pleasure the recent publication of Action for Scotland’s Biodiversity by the Scottish Biodiversity Group; believes that all departments and agencies of the Scottish Executive should use this as a basis to integrate biodiversity conservation into their plans and programmes; applauds the efforts of Scotland’s local authorities in producing local biodiversity action plans and encourages all departments and agencies of the Scottish Executive to assist authorities in implementing these plans, and urges the Minister for Environment, Sport and Culture to report on these positive steps to the Parliament and, thereafter, report further progress on the implementation in Scotland of the Convention of Biological Diversity every two years. Supported by: Mrs Mary Mulligan, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Nora Radcliffe, Elaine Smith
S1M-1364# Action for Biodiversity (lodged on 16 November 2000) Shona Robison*
S1M-1364# Action for Biodiversity (lodged on 16 November 2000) Euan Robson*, Donald Gorrie*
